translated: The kṛt and so on of the other side are not changed to iṭ from the root śrī and also from the roots that have the same aṭ and from the roots that end in uka.🔽The śrit, the śritavān,🔽the bhūta, the bhūtavān,

original: (zad par byed /
analyzed: (zad par byed /
translated: the kṣaya, the kṣayavān.

original: zad/) 'grel par nishth'a pha rol la a'urnu'i thung ngur 'gyur ro zhes byung bas /
analyzed: zad/) 'grel par nishth'a pha rol la a'urnu'i thung ngur 'gyur ro zhes byung bas /
translated: In the commentary, it says that the short ūrṇu is for the other side.

original: aurnu ta:/...(bkab/) ra d'a bhy'am nishth'a ta na:p'urba sya tsa nga:/
analyzed: aurnu ta:/...(bkab/) ra d'a bhy'am nishth'a ta na:p'urba sya tsa nga:/
translated: The ūrṇuta, the rādābhyāṃ niṣṭhātaḥ pūrvasya ca.

original: ra da dag las nishth'a'i ta na ste snga ma'i da'i 'ang ngo //
analyzed: ra da dag las nishth'a'i ta na ste snga ma'i da'i 'ang ngo //
translated: From ra and da, niṣṭhāyate; the da of the former also.

original: byings mtha' ra yig dang (gus pa byas/) @437a * //
analyzed: byings mtha' ra yig dang (gus pa byas/) @437a * //
translated: The final of the root, the ra, and the da.

original: da dag las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar 'gyur zhing de'i snga ma'i da'ang nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da dag las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar 'gyur zhing de'i snga ma'i da'ang nar 'gyur te /
translated: From them, niṣṭhāyate of the other; the da of the former also becomes ya.

original: shr'i lakta sbyar byings kyi r'ita kyi aita 'os /
analyzed: shr'i lakta sbyar byings kyi r'ita kyi aita 'os /
translated: The i of śrīlakṣaṇa is added to the root.

original: r'i aita / ri'i aan la ra pha rol los ru /
analyzed: r'i aita / ri'i aan la ra pha rol los ru /
translated: The i of ra, the aṃ of ri, the ra of the other, and the lo.

original: hal sogs kyis ring po mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas /🔽sh'irna:/ bhi dir la kta mdo 'di sa ta dang da gnyis ka nar bsgyur bas /
analyzed: hal sogs kyis ring po mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas / sh'irna:/ bhi dir la kta mdo 'di sa ta dang da gnyis ka nar bsgyur bas /
translated: By hal and so on, the long [vowel] is changed to ta by this sūtra.🔽The i of śrī, the ka of bhid, and the ta of the other.

original: bhinna:/ sam yo g'a de r'a to dh'a tor++ya nva ta:/
analyzed: bhinna:/ sam yo g'a de r'a to dh'a tor++ya nva ta:/
translated: By this sūtra, both the sa and the da are changed to ya.🔽bhinnaḥ, samyogād, devarāto dhatoryavan.

original: byings a'ata mtha' yan can las brtsegs pa dang po las so //
analyzed: byings a'ata mtha' yan can las brtsegs pa dang po las so //
translated: From the root āta ending in ya, the first akṣara is stacked.

original: byings a'ata mtha' can au pa dh'a na yan so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yod pa brtsegs pa dang po las kyang pha ('tshe bar byas/) rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
analyzed: byings a'ata mtha' can au pa dh'a na yan so sor bsdu ba'i yi ge yod pa brtsegs pa dang po las kyang pha ('tshe bar byas/) rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
translated: The root āta ending in ya, upa-dhāna, having the individual collecting letter, the first akṣara is also changed to niṣṭhāyate of the other.

original: dr'a na:/ gl'a na:/
analyzed: dr'a na:/ gl'a na:/
translated: dṛṣṇā, galā.

original: sogs so// (rnam 'joms/) lv'a di bhyashtsa /
analyzed: sogs so// (rnam 'joms/) lv'a di bhyashtsa /
translated: [The affixes] lavdhi, etc.,

original: l'u la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo //
analyzed: l'u la sogs pa rnams las kyang ngo //
translated: are also from lu, etc.

original: l'u la sogs pa rnams las kyang pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
analyzed: l'u la sogs pa rnams las kyang pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
translated: Also from lu, etc., the affix niṣṭhā is changed to ta.

original: l'u na:/ dz'i na:/
analyzed: l'u na:/ dz'i na:/
translated: Lu-naḥ, jīnaḥ.

original: (rgas/) 'grel par du gu dag gi nishth'a pha rol la ring por 'gyur ro zhes byung bas /
analyzed: (rgas/) 'grel par du gu dag gi nishth'a pha rol la ring por 'gyur ro zhes byung bas /
translated: In the commentary, it says that from du-gu, niṣṭhā becomes long in the other.

original: b'u na:/ g'u na:/🔽kta ao di tashtsa /
analyzed: b'u na:/ g'u na:/ kta ao di tashtsa /
translated: Bau-naḥ, gau-naḥ.🔽And so on from ka.

original: (smad par bya /🔽dga' zad/) aota 'gro ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: (smad par bya / dga' zad/) aota 'gro ba las kyang ngo //
translated: [The affixes] kaṭ, etc.,🔽are also from ota.

original: byings aota 'gro ba rnams las kyang nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
analyzed: byings aota 'gro ba rnams las kyang nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
translated: From the root ota, the affix niṣṭhā is changed to ta.

original: bhu dzo gya gyu la kta tsu'i ku mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas /
analyzed: bhu dzo gya gyu la kta tsu'i ku mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas /
translated: By this sūtra, kaṭ is changed to ta.

original: (bcad / dzy'i pa kta /🔽gra nyi dzy'a sogs kyis sam pra s'a ran/) bhugna:/
analyzed: (bcad / dzy'i pa kta / gra nyi dzy'a sogs kyis sam pra s'a ran/) bhugna:/
translated: Bhuj-naḥ.

original: ao h'aka la mdo 'dis ta na /
analyzed: ao h'aka la mdo 'dis ta na /
translated: From the root ohaka, by this sūtra, ta is changed to na.

original: ghu m'asth'a sogs...(phyin/) kyis a'ita du bsgyur pra sngon /
analyzed: ghu m'asth'a sogs...(phyin/) kyis a'ita du bsgyur pra sngon /
translated: From ghu-mā-sthā, etc., [the affix] īt is changed to i.

original: pra h'i na:/ sv'a da yo& nu di ta:/
analyzed: pra h'i na:/ sv'a da yo& nu di ta:/
translated: Pra-hīnaḥ, svā-dāya, anu-ditaḥ.

original: s'u la sogs pa rnams auta 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: s'u la sogs pa rnams auta 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Sau and so on are not the names of going.

original: s'u la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: s'u la sogs pa ste /
translated: Sau and so on are

original: sh'ung srog chags mngal nas skye ba /
analyzed: sh'ung srog chags mngal nas skye ba /
translated: Shaun, a living being born from a womb.

original: d'ung gdung ba /🔽d'ing zad pa /
analyzed: d'ung gdung ba / d'ing zad pa /
translated: Dun, suffering.🔽Ding, exhaustion.

original: m'ing 'tshe ba /
analyzed: m'ing 'tshe ba /
translated: Min, harm.

original: r'ing nyan pa /
analyzed: r'ing nyan pa /
translated: Rin, listening.🔽Lin, embracing.🔽Rin, obscuration.🔽Sau, dun,🔽vai, min,🔽rin, lin,

original: (g-yo byas/) l'ing 'khyud pa /
analyzed: (g-yo byas/) l'ing 'khyud pa /
translated: bri,🔽and so on are not the names of going.

original: br'ing sgrib pa rnams auta 'gro ba'i ming can ma yin zhing aota (rab tu btang/) 'gro ba bzhin nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
analyzed: br'ing sgrib pa rnams auta 'gro ba'i ming can ma yin zhing aota (rab tu btang/) 'gro ba bzhin nishth'a'i ta nar bsgyur te /
translated: Like the word ot, which means going, is transformed into nit, which means not going,🔽sau,🔽dun,

original: s'u na:/ d'u na:/
analyzed: s'u na:/ d'u na:/
translated: vai,

original: b'i na:/ m'i na:/
analyzed: b'i na:/ m'i na:/
translated: min,🔽rin,🔽lin,

original: r'i na:/ l'i na:/
analyzed: r'i na:/ l'i na:/
translated: bri,🔽and so on are not the names of going.

original: br'i na:/ s'u na b'an /🔽sogs so // sph'a ya:sph'i nishth'a y'am /🔽nishth'a la sph'a y'i'i sph'i'o //
analyzed: br'i na:/ s'u na b'an / sogs so // sph'a ya:sph'i nishth'a y'am / nishth'a la sph'a y'i'i sph'i'o //
translated: Sphaya, sphini, nisthaya,🔽or nisthala sphāyi sphā.

original: nishth'a pha rol la sph'a y'i ni sph'i zhes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nishth'a pha rol la sph'a y'i ni sph'i zhes par 'gyur te /
translated: Nisthā, the other side, is sphāyā, and nisthala is sphā.🔽Spha,🔽or sphā is explained in the commentary.

original: sph'i ta:/ 'grel par yang na sph'a zhes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas /🔽sph'a ta:/...('phel/) dra ba m'urti sparsha yo:shya:/
analyzed: sph'i ta:/ 'grel par yang na sph'a zhes par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pas / sph'a ta:/...('phel/) dra ba m'urti sparsha yo:shya:/
translated: Spha,🔽Dvā murti sparśayoḥ syāt.

original: khu ba'i / (skyes /🔽gdung / zad /
analyzed: khu ba'i / (skyes / gdung / zad /
translated: In the case of semen,🔽suffering,🔽exhaustion,

original: 'tshe ba byas /
analyzed: 'tshe ba byas /
translated: harm,

original: nyan / 'khyud /
analyzed: nyan / 'khyud /
translated: to listen, to embrace,🔽to cover, to be born,

original: sgrib / skyes zin/) gong bu dang reg pa dag la shy'a'i 'o //🔽khu ba'i gong bu reg pa dag brjod pa la shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrib / skyes zin/) gong bu dang reg pa dag la shy'a'i 'o // khu ba'i gong bu reg pa dag brjod pa la shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
translated: to a mass and to contact, the śaya suffix.

original: ('phel/) sh'i to b'a yu:/
analyzed: ('phel/) sh'i to b'a yu:/
translated: The śaya suffix becomes niṣṭhā in the sense of “to the other side” and samprasāraṇa in the sense of “to a mass of liquid.”🔽śayato vāyuḥ

original: (bsil ba'i rlung/) shyo& sparshe /🔽shy'a @437b las reg pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: (bsil ba'i rlung/) shyo& sparshe / shy'a @437b las reg pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: śayaṃ sparśaḥ🔽The śaya suffix is not used for contact.

original: shy'a las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta yig reg pa brjod pa ma yin pa la nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shy'a las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta yig reg pa brjod pa ma yin pa la nar 'gyur te /
translated: The śaya suffix becomes niṣṭhā in the sense of “to the other side” and not in the sense of contact.

original: shya la kta /
analyzed: shya la kta /
translated: śayalakaṭ

original: mdo snga mas sam pra s'a ra na /
analyzed: mdo snga mas sam pra s'a ra na /
translated: The previous sūtra has samprasāraṇa.

original: mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas /
analyzed: mdo 'dis ta nar bsgyur bas /
translated: This sūtra has tan.

original: sh'i nam ghri tam /
analyzed: sh'i nam ghri tam /
translated: śayanasya gṛhṇan🔽pratiṣṭhaḥ

original: pra teshtsa / pra ti las kyang ngo //
analyzed: pra teshtsa / pra ti las kyang ngo //
translated: prati also.

original: pra ti las pha rol gyi shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur bas /🔽pra ti sh'i nam /
analyzed: pra ti las pha rol gyi shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar bsgyur bas / pra ti sh'i nam /
translated: prati becomes niṣṭhā in the sense of “to the other side” and samprasāraṇa in the sense of “to a mass of liquid.”🔽pratiśayanasya

original: pra ti sh'i na b'an /🔽bi bh'a sh'a bhya ba p'urba sya /
analyzed: pra ti sh'i na b'an / bi bh'a sh'a bhya ba p'urba sya /
translated: pratiśayanāvaṇa🔽vibhāṣā bhavati pūrvasya

original: aa bhi aa ba snga ma'i yang na'o //
analyzed: aa bhi aa ba snga ma'i yang na'o //
translated: abhi avasya api

original: aa bhi dang aa pa snga ma'i shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar yang na 'gyur te /🔽aa bhi sh'i nam /
analyzed: aa bhi dang aa pa snga ma'i shy'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar yang na 'gyur te / aa bhi sh'i nam /
translated: abhi and apa, the nistha of the former śaya, in the sense of “on the other side,” or “in the sense of samprāśa.”🔽abhiṣiṇam

original: aa bhi shy'a nam /
analyzed: aa bhi shy'a nam /
translated: abhiṣyānam

original: (mar gyi gong bu/) aa ba sh'i nam /🔽aa ba shy'a nam /
analyzed: (mar gyi gong bu/) aa ba sh'i nam / aa ba shy'a nam /
translated: (a lump of butter)🔽avasīnam🔽avasīyānam🔽aṃśo

original: aanytso& na b'a d'a ne /🔽byung khungs ma yin pa la aanytsa las so //
analyzed: aanytso& na b'a d'a ne / byung khungs ma yin pa la aanytsa las so //
translated: aṃśāne🔽(not a source)

original: byung (gong bu so sor/) khungs brjod pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa la aanytsa las nishth'a'i ta nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byung (gong bu so sor/) khungs brjod pa dang 'brel pa ma yin pa la aanytsa las nishth'a'i ta nar 'gyur te /
translated: aṃśa, in the sense of “not a source,” becomes nisthāt in the sense of “not expressing a source.”

original: tsu'i ku aita 'gro ba ma yin pa sogs kyis na phyis pas /
analyzed: tsu'i ku aita 'gro ba ma yin pa sogs kyis na phyis pas /
translated: cūka, in the sense of “not going,” and so on, is declined.🔽agniḥ

original: aagna:/ di bo&amp ;
analyzed: aagna:/ di bo&amp ;
translated: (a yoke)🔽vijigīṣāyāṃ🔽dibale

original: (bkol ba/) bi dzi g'i sh'a y'am /🔽di ba las (kun du gong bu/) rgyal ba ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: (bkol ba/) bi dzi g'i sh'a y'am / di ba las (kun du gong bu/) rgyal ba ma yin pa la'o //
translated: (a lump)

original: dib las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta yig rgyal ba brjod pa ma yin pa la nar bsgyur te /
analyzed: dib las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta yig rgyal ba brjod pa ma yin pa la nar bsgyur te /
translated: dibale, in the sense of “not a conqueror,” becomes nisthāt in the sense of “not expressing a conqueror.”

original: di ba lakta /
analyzed: di ba lakta /
translated: dibālaktam

original: tsha ba dag gi rjes su sna ldan la'ang sha a'utha dag gos /
analyzed: tsha ba dag gi rjes su sna ldan la'ang sha a'utha dag gos /
translated: After the sibilants, śa and ṣa are also added to the nasal.

original: bu a'ur bsgyur /
analyzed: bu a'ur bsgyur /
translated: The son is changed to ū.

original: aika gi aatsa la (mchod/) yanar bsgyur bas /
analyzed: aika gi aatsa la (mchod/) yanar bsgyur bas /
translated: The a of ika is changed to a of acala (unmoving).

original: dy'un:/ rgyal ba brjod pa yin na ta nar mi bsgyur bas /
analyzed: dy'un:/ rgyal ba brjod pa yin na ta nar mi bsgyur bas /
translated: If it is the Victor (jina) that is expressed, it is not changed to tana.

original: dy'utva:/ nirb'a no&amp ;
analyzed: dy'utva:/ nirb'a no&amp ;
translated: Nirvana.

original: b'a te / rlung ma yin pa la nirb'a na'o //
analyzed: b'a te / rlung ma yin pa la nirb'a na'o //
translated: In the case of not being wind, it is nirvana.

original: nir snga ma'i b'a 'gro ba la kta sbyar bas /
analyzed: nir snga ma'i b'a 'gro ba la kta sbyar bas /
translated: Nir is connected to the previous va, and kata is connected to going.

original: nirb'a na zhes pa rlung brjod pa ma yin pa la tshig phrad do //
analyzed: nirb'a na zhes pa rlung brjod pa ma yin pa la tshig phrad do //
translated: Nirvana is a compound word for not being wind.

original: rlung yin na ta nar ma bsgyur bas /🔽b'a da:/ shu sha ka:/
analyzed: rlung yin na ta nar ma bsgyur bas / b'a da:/ shu sha ka:/
translated: If it is wind, it is not changed to tana.🔽Vata.🔽Shushka.

original: shusha las ka'o //
analyzed: shusha las ka'o //
translated: From shusha, ka.

original: shusha las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta kar bsgyur te /
analyzed: shusha las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta kar bsgyur te /
translated: From shusha, the other nisthaa is changed to kara.

original: shusha ka:/ pa tso ba:/
analyzed: shusha ka:/ pa tso ba:/
translated: Shushka. Pacchava.

original: (gsal ba/) btsa las ba'o //
analyzed: (gsal ba/) btsa las ba'o //
translated: From btsa, va.

original: patsa las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta bar bsgyur te /
analyzed: patsa las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta bar bsgyur te /
translated: From pacha, the other nisthaa is changed to va.

original: tsu'i kur bsgyur bas /
analyzed: tsu'i kur bsgyur bas /
translated: From tsu, ku is changed.

original: (me/) pa kva:/ ksh'a yo ma:/
analyzed: (me/) pa kva:/ ksh'a yo ma:/
translated: Paka. Kshayom.

original: kshee las ma'o //
analyzed: kshee las ma'o //
translated: From kshe, ma.

original: kshee las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta mar bsgyur te /
analyzed: kshee las pha rol gyi nishth'a'i ta mar bsgyur te /
translated: From kshe, the other nisthaa is changed to ma.

original: (rlung/) ksh'a ma:/ ksh'a ma b'an /
analyzed: (rlung/) ksh'a ma:/ ksh'a ma b'an /
translated: Kshama. Kshamavaan.

original: prastyo& n+ya ta ra sy'am /
analyzed: prastyo& n+ya ta ra sy'am /
translated: Prasthyaam, nyatarasam.

original: prasty'a las yang na'o //
analyzed: prasty'a las yang na'o //
translated: From prasthā, also.

original: prasty'a las pha rol (skams/) gyi nishth'a'i ta mar yang na 'gyur te /🔽prast'i ma:/ prast'i ta:/
analyzed: prasty'a las pha rol (skams/) gyi nishth'a'i ta mar yang na 'gyur te / prast'i ma:/ prast'i ta:/
translated: From prasthā, the far side of niṣṭhā becomes ta or ma.

original: stya:pra p'urba sya /🔽pra sngon ma'i sty'a'i 'o //
analyzed: stya:pra p'urba sya / pra sngon ma'i sty'a'i 'o //
translated: prasthitaḥ, prasthitā, prasthitam.🔽sya, prapurvasya.

original: pra sngon ma'i (smin/) sty'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pra sngon ma'i (smin/) sty'a'i nishth'a pha rol la sam pra s'a ra nar 'gyur te /
translated: prapurvasya prasthāyā niṣṭhā pharasāram.

original: dper brjod bstan zin to //🔽kshi ba kri (zad/) sholl'a gh'a:/
analyzed: dper brjod bstan zin to // kshi ba kri (zad/) sholl'a gh'a:/
translated: The examples have been taught.🔽kṣīva, kṛṣi, lāghavam.

original: kshi ba/.. ..(rgyas pa/) kri sha...(/ phra mo /🔽nus pa/)...au ll'a gha sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kshi ba/.. ..(rgyas pa/) kri sha...(/ phra mo / nus pa/)...au ll'a gha sogs pa rnams so //
translated: kṣīva, kṛṣi, lāghavam, etc.

original: kshe ba dang / kri sha dang / (rab tu tshogs/) aulla gha rnams @438a * //
analyzed: kshe ba dang / kri sha dang / (rab tu tshogs/) aulla gha rnams @438a * //
translated: kṣīva, kṛṣi, lāghavam, etc.

original: kta'i ta tshig phrad las aa yig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: kta'i ta tshig phrad las aa yig tu byas pa'o //
translated: are from kta-tā-tiṅ.

original: a'a di tashtsa /
analyzed: a'a di tashtsa /
translated: āditśca.

original: a'ata 'gro ba las kyang ngo //
analyzed: a'ata 'gro ba las kyang ngo //
translated: āt, also from gati.

original: byings a'ata 'gro ba las pha rol gyi nishth'a la ait 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byings a'ata 'gro ba las pha rol gyi nishth'a la ait 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: From the root āt, the far side of gati does not become it.

original: ti tsa / ta la'ang ngo //
analyzed: ti tsa / ta la'ang ngo //
translated: ti ca, talam also.

original: krita kyi rkyen ta dang po can pha rol la tsa ra dang pha la dag gi au pa dh'a'i aa auta du 'gyur te /
analyzed: krita kyi rkyen ta dang po can pha rol la tsa ra dang pha la dag gi au pa dh'a'i aa auta du 'gyur te /
translated: The condition of kṛt becomes ta with the first, and the upa of upapada becomes ōta with pa and pha.

original: pra sngon ma'i pa l'a la kta mdo snga mas ait mi 'gyur /
analyzed: pra sngon ma'i pa l'a la kta mdo snga mas ait mi 'gyur /
translated: The previous case ending la becomes ita with pa.

analyzed: dga' ba brjod de mtho bar byas/) gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs zin bris su bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba las krita la sogs pa byings las ming du bsgrub pa'i cho ga spyir btang dmigs bsal dang bcas pa rags pa rnams re zhig rdzogs so /
translated: By these, the great treatise on grammar, the Pāṇini Vyakaraṇa, along with the meaning of the text, the ritual, examples, and so on, have been recorded in this work called The Chariot that Leads to the Jewel of Eloquence. The general and specific rituals for forming nouns from verbal roots such as kṛt and so on have been roughly completed for the time being.

original: // /'grel pa'i mjug tu sbyar byang dang shis pa brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa byung ba ni /

analyzed: srog chags thams cad bkra shis shing //

analyzed: sa dang sa bdag bkra shis shog / ces pa'o //

original: de ltar brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po brgyad kyi nang tshan de rnams kyi nang nas kyang go don cho ga sogs phul du phyin pa mdor na sgra'i gtsug lag thams cad kyi phyi mo lta bur gyur ba 'o skol gyi ston pa mnyam med sh'akya'i rgyal
analyzed: de ltar brda sprod pa'i bstan bcos chen po brgyad kyi nang tshan de rnams kyi nang nas kyang go don cho ga sogs phul du phyin pa mdor na sgra'i gtsug lag thams cad kyi phyi mo lta bur gyur ba 'o skol gyi ston pa mnyam med sh'akya'i rgyal
translated: Among those eight great treatises on grammar, the one with the most excellent meaning, ritual, and so forth, in short, like the root of all the scriptures on sound, was taught by our incomparable Teacher, the King of the Shakyas.

original: pos 'jam dpal rtsa ba'i rgyud sogs su lung bstan pa'i bram ze chen po p'a ni ni la 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug gis dngos su stsal ba /
analyzed: pos 'jam dpal rtsa ba'i rgyud sogs su lung bstan pa'i bram ze chen po p'a ni ni la 'phags pa 'jig rten dbang phyug gis dngos su stsal ba /
translated: The great Brahmin Panini, who was prophesied in the Root Tantra of Manjushri and so forth, was directly given by the Noble Lord of the World.

original: p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs reg zig tu bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: p'a ni ni by'a ka ra na gzhung 'grel gyi go don cho ga dper brjod sogs reg zig tu bkod pa legs bshad nor bu 'dren pa'i shing rta zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: The text called Chariot that Guides the Jewel of Eloquence: A Brief Presentation of the Meaning of the Text and Commentary of the Pāṇini Grammar, along with Examples of Its Application, was composed by me,

original: rang cag gangs ri'i khrod pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa med pa'i skyabs dang dpung gnyen dam pa 'phags pa phyag na padmo nyid gsum ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bzhengs pa don gyi slad du mtshan nas smos te /
analyzed: rang cag gangs ri'i khrod pa rnams kyi mtshungs pa med pa'i skyabs dang dpung gnyen dam pa 'phags pa phyag na padmo nyid gsum ldan rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur bzhengs pa don gyi slad du mtshan nas smos te /
translated: the one who is the incomparable refuge and protector of us all who live in the snowy land of Tibet, the noble Avalokiteśvara, who has arisen in the form of a vajra holder endowed with the three sets of ten qualities, the great omniscient Gyalwang, Ngawang Losang Gyatso Jikmé Gocha Thupten Langtso Dé, the son of Brahmā, Shedrup Gyaltsen, who is also known as Shedrup Jé.

original: rgyal dbang thams cad mkhyen pa chen po ngag dbang blo bzang rgya mtsho 'jigs med go cha thub bstan lang tsho'i sde tshangs sras bzhad pa'i rdo rjes mnyam pa med pa'i thugs rje'i zer gyis bskyangs shing /
analyzed: rgyal dbang thams cad mkhyen pa chen po ngag dbang blo bzang rgya mtsho 'jigs med go cha thub bstan lang tsho'i sde tshangs sras bzhad pa'i rdo rjes mnyam pa med pa'i thugs rje'i zer gyis bskyangs shing /
translated: He was nurtured by the incomparable compassion of the great omniscient Gyalwang, Ngawang Losang Gyatso Jikmé Gocha Thupten Langtso Dé, the son of Brahmā, Shedrup Gyaltsen, who is also known as Shedrup Jé.

original: pandi ta mched la gser dngul zho grangs brgya phrag du ma sogs ci 'dod kyi yo byad mtha' dag 'bad med du stsal te /
analyzed: pandi ta mched la gser dngul zho grangs brgya phrag du ma sogs ci 'dod kyi yo byad mtha' dag 'bad med du stsal te /
translated: He offered the two brothers, the paṇḍitas, whatever they needed, such as hundreds of measures of silver and gold, without any difficulty.

original: bka' 'bangs la'ang khyod kyis gzhung bod skad du bsgyur ba dang / 'grel pa'i go don dper brjod zin bris su 'debs pa sogs kyis shig ces bka'i gnang ba thob par brten /
analyzed: bka' 'bangs la'ang khyod kyis gzhung bod skad du bsgyur ba dang / 'grel pa'i go don dper brjod zin bris su 'debs pa sogs kyis shig ces bka'i gnang ba thob par brten /
translated: He also gave me the order: “You should translate the text into Tibetan and write down the meaning of the commentary and the examples.”

original: dam pa gang de'i gzhal du med pa'i bka' drin las brda sprod pa'i ring lugs la cung zad tsam sbyangs pa bka' 'bangs kyi tha chungs gtsang stod 'dar gyi sa'i char se'i rigs las skyes pa ngag dbang phun tshogs lhun grub bam /
analyzed: dam pa gang de'i gzhal du med pa'i bka' drin las brda sprod pa'i ring lugs la cung zad tsam sbyangs pa bka' 'bangs kyi tha chungs gtsang stod 'dar gyi sa'i char se'i rigs las skyes pa ngag dbang phun tshogs lhun grub bam /
translated: I, the youngest of his subjects, Ngawang Phuntsok Lhundrup, born in the Se clan in the upper part of Tsang, in the region of Dar, have studied a little of the tradition of grammar through the immeasurable kindness of that holy one.

original: ming gzhan tshe dbang rab brtan rdo rjer bod pa'i rmongs brtul snyom las pas /
analyzed: ming gzhan tshe dbang rab brtan rdo rjer bod pa'i rmongs brtul snyom las pas /
translated: I, who am called Tshewang Rabten Dorje, a lazy Tibetan who is ignorant and foolish,

original: 'phags yul ku ru kshe trar bram ze gtsang ma'i rigs su 'khrungs pa gnas lnga rig pa'i ma h'a pandi ta ba la bha dra dang / pandi ta go ku la n'a tha mi shra mched kyi drung du gzhung gi sgra sgrub dang go don @452a * //
analyzed: 'phags yul ku ru kshe trar bram ze gtsang ma'i rigs su 'khrungs pa gnas lnga rig pa'i ma h'a pandi ta ba la bha dra dang / pandi ta go ku la n'a tha mi shra mched kyi drung du gzhung gi sgra sgrub dang go don @452a * //
translated: studied the grammar of the text and its meaning in the presence of the great pandit Balaprabha, who was born in a pure Brahmin family in Kuruksetra in the land of the noble ones, and of the two brothers, the pandits Gokulanatha and Misra.

original: dper brjod sogs legs par nyan te gzhung bod skad du bsgyur /
analyzed: dper brjod sogs legs par nyan te gzhung bod skad du bsgyur /
translated: I listened well to the examples and so forth, and translated the text into Tibetan.

original: slob dpon chen po r'a ma tsandras mdzad pa'i 'grel pa pra kri ya ste rab tu bya ba zhes pa gzhir bzhag / kun bshad sogs cho ga rtogs dka' ba rnams la slob dpon mkhas pa'i gsung rgyun gyis zur brgyan te cung zad rgyas par byas /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po r'a ma tsandras mdzad pa'i 'grel pa pra kri ya ste rab tu bya ba zhes pa gzhir bzhag / kun bshad sogs cho ga rtogs dka' ba rnams la slob dpon mkhas pa'i gsung rgyun gyis zur brgyan te cung zad rgyas par byas /
translated: I took as a basis the commentary called Prakṛiyakriyā, composed by the great master Rāmacandra, and I slightly expanded it by adding some ornaments with the oral tradition of learned masters on the difficult-to-understand topics such as the complete explanation and so forth.

original: rtogs sla ba rnams nyung ngur byas te /
analyzed: rtogs sla ba rnams nyung ngur byas te /
translated: I made the easy-to-understand topics brief.

original: me mkha' rgya mtsho la 'das lo drug cu skor bcu dang nya gsum cu rtsa gcig bsre ba rnam 'phyang zhes pa sa pho khyi lo rang lo (rtsa ba sgrub kyi mtshan bu zhip pa btab yod/) nyer lngar sleb pa chu stod zla ba'i yar tshes dge bar
analyzed: me mkha' rgya mtsho la 'das lo drug cu skor bcu dang nya gsum cu rtsa gcig bsre ba rnam 'phyang zhes pa sa pho khyi lo rang lo (rtsa ba sgrub kyi mtshan bu zhip pa btab yod/) nyer lngar sleb pa chu stod zla ba'i yar tshes dge bar
translated: The year of the male earth dog (1478) was the sixty-first year of the sexagenary cycle, and the thirty-first year of my life.

original: 'go brtsams / kun ldan zhes pa lcags byi nag pa zla ba'i dmar phyogs kyi rgyal ba gsum pa pa she'i 'grub sbyor gyi dus dge bar chos grva chen po dpal ldan 'bras spungs kyi rang shag rgyud steng spyil por sbyar ba 'dis kyang bstan pa dang sems can yongs la
analyzed: 'go brtsams / kun ldan zhes pa lcags byi nag pa zla ba'i dmar phyogs kyi rgyal ba gsum pa pa she'i 'grub sbyor gyi dus dge bar chos grva chen po dpal ldan 'bras spungs kyi rang shag rgyud steng spyil por sbyar ba 'dis kyang bstan pa dang sems can yongs la
translated: May this work be of benefit to the teachings and to all beings.🔽Since I am very young in terms of intelligence, there are many mistakes in the translation and contradictions and errors in the examples and meanings.

original: phan par gyur cig / ces pa 'di la bdag nyid blo gros kyi na tshod shin tu gzhon pas 'gyur ma dag pa dang / dper brjod go don sogs la 'gal 'khrul snang na bla ma mchog dang mkhas pa'i tshogs kyis bzod par mdzod la tshul bzhin 'chos par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: phan par gyur cig / ces pa 'di la bdag nyid blo gros kyi na tshod shin tu gzhon pas 'gyur ma dag pa dang / dper brjod go don sogs la 'gal 'khrul snang na bla ma mchog dang mkhas pa'i tshogs kyis bzod par mdzod la tshul bzhin 'chos par mdzad du gsol /
translated: If this is the case, may the supreme gurus and hosts of scholars forgive me and correct me properly.

original: dge 'dis dpal stug gsang ba kun 'dus rin chen gser gyi sa gzhi 'dzin //
analyzed: dge 'dis dpal stug gsang ba kun 'dus rin chen gser gyi sa gzhi 'dzin //
translated: By this virtue, may the glorious and precious earth of the Gathering of Secrets be held.

original: mtha' yas gdul bya skabs gsum yongs kyi gnyen gcig dpal ldan ngag gi dbang //
analyzed: mtha' yas gdul bya skabs gsum yongs kyi gnyen gcig dpal ldan ngag gi dbang //
translated: The sole friend of the three times of infinite disciples is the glorious lord of speech.

original: blo gros bzang po'i nyi zlas rab 'khyud rgya chen shes bya'i mkha' la khyab //
analyzed: blo gros bzang po'i nyi zlas rab 'khyud rgya chen shes bya'i mkha' la khyab //
translated: The sun and moon of good intelligence embrace it, pervading the sky of vast knowledge.🔽May the glory of the ocean-like knowledge of the Victorious One remain for a long time,

original: mtsho ltar zab yangs mkhyen pa'i dpal mnga' ji srid bar du brtan pa dang // bgrang yas skye dgu'i legs byas kyis bskrun lugs zung khrims kyi gdugs dkar po //
analyzed: mtsho ltar zab yangs mkhyen pa'i dpal mnga' ji srid bar du brtan pa dang // bgrang yas skye dgu'i legs byas kyis bskrun lugs zung khrims kyi gdugs dkar po //
translated: and may the white parasol of the two systems of ethics, created by the good deeds of innumerable beings,

original: phul byung khyon yangs 'dod dgu'i dpal ster yid bzhin nor bu'i tog gis sbras //
analyzed: phul byung khyon yangs 'dod dgu'i dpal ster yid bzhin nor bu'i tog gis sbras //
translated: be adorned with the crest-jewel, the source of the glory of all that is desired.🔽May the cooling shade of benefit and happiness,

original: nam yang 'gog med mkha' la rab bteg phan dang bde ba'i grib bsil gang //
analyzed: nam yang 'gog med mkha' la rab bteg phan dang bde ba'i grib bsil gang //
translated: which is always raised in the sky without obstruction,🔽be supremely beautiful, removing the heat of the discordant elements for the teachings and beings.

original: bstan dang 'gro ba'i mi mthun gdung sel mchog tu lhag par mdzes gyur cig / tshul 'dir log rtog rdul gyis nyer bsgribs nas //
analyzed: bstan dang 'gro ba'i mi mthun gdung sel mchog tu lhag par mdzes gyur cig / tshul 'dir log rtog rdul gyis nyer bsgribs nas //
translated: If the face of the text's meaning is obscured by the dust of wrong thoughts,

original: gzhung don dga' ma'i bzhin ras mi gsal na //
analyzed: gzhung don dga' ma'i bzhin ras mi gsal na //
translated: and the face of the beloved meaning is not clear,

original: mkhas mchog dam pa'i spyan sngar mi 'chab pas //
analyzed: mkhas mchog dam pa'i spyan sngar mi 'chab pas //
translated: I do not conceal it from the eyes of the supreme scholars.

original: dpyad gsum dag pas byi dor mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: dpyad gsum dag pas byi dor mdzad du gsol //
translated: I request them to polish it with the three analyses.

original: gang gi rig tshul gangg'a'i yab gcig las //
analyzed: gang gi rig tshul gangg'a'i yab gcig las //
translated: From the single father of the Ganges of reasoning methods,

original: nyer 'ongs legs tshogs rab dangs dal 'gro yis //
analyzed: nyer 'ongs legs tshogs rab dangs dal 'gro yis //
translated: May the pure light of the good and wholesome that has come to me

original: yid can rmongs pa'i dri ma kun bkrus nas //
analyzed: yid can rmongs pa'i dri ma kun bkrus nas //
translated: wash away all the stains of delusion of the beings,

original: kun mkhyen rin chen rgya mtshor 'jug par shog //
analyzed: kun mkhyen rin chen rgya mtshor 'jug par shog //
translated: and may they enter the ocean of the jewels of omniscience.
